## Gluten-Free Bean & Veggie Frittata  
A hearty, protein-packed brunch dish perfect for a holiday party, easily made gluten-free with simple ingredients.

### Ingredients  
- 8 large eggs  
- 1 cup cooked black beans (rinsed and drained if canned)  
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved  
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (or Monterey Jack)  
- 1 small red bell pepper, diced  
- 1 small green bell pepper, diced  
- 2 tablespoons olive oil  
- 1 teaspoon salt  
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper  
- 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika (optional)  
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley (optional)  

### Instructions  
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).  
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until smooth.  
3. Add salt, pepper, smoked paprika (if using), and chopped parsley to eggs; mix well.  
4. Stir in cooked beans, cherry tomatoes, diced bell peppers, and shredded cheese until evenly combined.  
5. Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet (10-inch or similar) over medium heat for 2 minutes.  
6. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet, spreading evenly.  
7. Cook on the stovetop over medium heat for 4-5 minutes, until edges begin to set.  
8. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until the frittata is puffed and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.  
9. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before slicing.  
10. Serve warm or at room temperature, cut into wedges.

### Notes  
- Use a non-stick or well-seasoned cast-iron skillet for easy oven transfer.  
- You can add chopped spinach or zucchini for extra vegetables.
